history.text: I really loved the movie 'The Imitation Game'. I thought the movie did a good job showing the life of Alan Turing.
I really like how it's based on a true story and tells us the history of one great man.
Yeah, I agree. I thought Benedict Cumberbatch did a really good acting job.
Do you usually like movies that are based on true stories?
Yes. That's why I especially likes this film.
Do you feel the score for this film by critics is too low for the quality of the film?
Yes, I think the Metacritic score was way too low. I don't understand why it only received a 73/100.
I think Keira Knightley was outstanding in her role as Joan Clarke, she really brought the character to life.
I agree. I thought Cumberbatch and Keira had excellent chemistry together.
Does it bother you that the movie takes a few liberties with the source material or is that fine to make the movie more interesting?
I think it's OK to take some liberties to move the story forward. However, I like the movie to try and stay as close to factual information as possible.
I really like the world war 2 setting and the mystery that comes with the Nazis.
I definitely think it was the best film of 2014.
Do you think it was okay for him to hide his homosexuality and should it have been part of the movie?
He had to hide his sexuality. He didn't have a choice. Yes, I think it was extremely important to be included in the movie because that was a central theme to his own life.
Do you think he proposed marriage to make sure the project would get completed under him without anyone finding out?
Yes, I think that was the reason.
Why do you think it got such a low score from certain critics and others rated it highly?
I think some might have had a problem with the liberties taken.
Do you think it was fair for Menzies to require them to destroy their work after the war?
No, I don't think it was fair because they should have kept it for future generations to be able to look at and study.
Do you think the other cryptographers could have figured out how to break the code without Turings machine?
No, I don't think they could have.
Do you think it was fair to feed the Soviets information when it was in the British advantage?
No, because innocent British people died because of that.
